definition: to do everything oneself (idiom); not to allow others in on the act
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
to substitute for/to take the place of/to replace/for/on behalf of/to stand in for
lit. to go beyond the sacrificial altar and take over the kitchen (idiom); fig. to exceed one's place and meddle in other people's affairs/to take matters into one's own hands
to undertake to do everything by oneself/to run the whole show
head of a household/family head/patriarch/parent or guardian of a child
to let sb do whatever they want/to indulge/to give free reins to/to let things slide/to drift aimlessly/laissez-faire
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
